alert.note: Alert for Bureau; La Salle; Putnam (Illinois) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Chicago (Northeastern Illinois and Northwestern Indiana)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued January 27 at 11:43AM CST until further notice by NWS Chicago
info.description: ...Forecast flooding changed from Minor to Moderate severity for the following rivers in Illinois... Illinois River at La Salle affecting Bureau, La Salle and Putnam Counties. For the Upper Illinois River...including Morris, Ottawa, La Salle... Moderate flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Minor flooding is occurring and moderate flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Illinois River from Starved Rock Lock and Dam downstream to the confluence with Big Bureau Creek, including the La Salle gauge. * WHEN...Until further notice. * IMPACTS...At 28.0 feet, Dee Bennett Road is threatened between Ottawa and Utica. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 10:45 AM CST Saturday, the river stage was 25.8 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 27.0 feet tomorrow morning. - Flood stage is 20.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: River rises are being affected by snowmelt caused by above freezing temperatures. Changes to the temperature forecast may cause changes to the river forecast. A Flood Warning means water levels above flood stage are imminent or may already be occurring. Persons along rivers and streams in the warned area should take immediate precautions to protect life and property. Report flooding to the National Weather Service or your local law enforcement agency only when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by late tonight at 545 AM CST.
